name: bear-open-note
description: Read the full text content of a Bear note from your library. Always includes text extracted from attached images and PDFs (aka OCR search) with clear labeling.

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.desc: Exact note identifier (ID) obtained from bear-search-notes

name: bear-create-note
description: Create a new note in your Bear library with optional title, content, and tags. The note will be immediately available in Bear app.

arguments.name: title
arguments.desc: Note title, e.g., "Meeting Notes" or "Research Ideas"

arguments.name: text
arguments.desc: Note content in markdown format

arguments.name: tags
arguments.desc: Tags separated by commas, e.g., "work,project,urgent"

name: bear-search-notes
description: Find notes in your Bear library by searching text content, filtering by tags, or date ranges. Always searches within attached images and PDF files via OCR. Returns a list with titles and IDs.

arguments.name: term
arguments.desc: Text to search for in note titles and content

arguments.name: tag
arguments.desc: Tag to filter notes by (without # symbol)

arguments.name: limit
arguments.desc: Maximum number of results to return (default: 50)

arguments.name: createdAfter
arguments.desc: Filter notes created on or after this date. Supports relative dates or ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)

arguments.name: createdBefore
arguments.desc: Filter notes created on or before this date. Supports relative dates or ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)

arguments.name: modifiedAfter
arguments.desc: Filter notes modified on or after this date. Supports relative dates or ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)

arguments.name: modifiedBefore
arguments.desc: Filter notes modified on or before this date. Supports relative dates or ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD)

name: bear-add-text
description: Add text to an existing Bear note at the beginning or end. Can target a specific section using header. Use bear-search-notes first to get the note ID.

arguments.name: id
arguments.desc: Note identifier (ID) from bear-search-notes

arguments.name: text
arguments.desc: Text content to add to the note

arguments.name: header
arguments.desc: Optional section header to target (adds text within that section)

arguments.name: position
arguments.desc: Where to insert: 'end' (default) for appending, 'beginning' for prepending

name: bear-add-file
description: Attach a file to an existing Bear note. Encode the file to base64 using shell commands and provide the encoded content. Use bear-search-notes first to get the note ID.

arguments.name: base64_content
arguments.desc: Base64-encoded file content

arguments.name: filename
arguments.desc: Filename with extension (e.g., budget.xlsx, report.pdf)

arguments.name: id
arguments.desc: Exact note identifier (ID) obtained from bear-search-notes

arguments.name: title
arguments.desc: Note title if ID is not available

name: bear-list-tags
description: List all tags in your Bear library as a hierarchical tree. Shows tag names with note counts. Useful for understanding your tag structure and finding tags to apply to untagged notes.

name: bear-find-untagged-notes
description: Find notes in your Bear library that have no tags. Useful for organizing and categorizing notes.

arguments.name: limit
arguments.desc: Maximum number of results (default: 50)

name: bear-add-tag
description: Add one or more tags to an existing Bear note. Tags are added at the beginning of the note. Use bear-list-tags to see available tags.

arguments.name: id
arguments.desc: Note identifier (ID) from bear-search-notes or bear-find-untagged-notes

arguments.name: tags
arguments.desc: Tag names without # symbol (e.g., ["career", "career/meetings"])
